intro: Parosela mollis, commonly known as the silky parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features soft, silvery-white hairs on its leaves and stems, giving it a velvety appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Parosela mollis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
